ing: 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
des: "This recipe has been made and served in my mother's family for as long as I can remember. It is traditionally served with turkey and mashed potatoes. To save fat and calories, I cut the amount of butter and sugar for the topping in half, but for full flavor it is better with the full amount."
ins:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, flour, baking powder and sugar. Add corn and pour into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes.
In a small sauce pan, combine butter, sugar, water and flour. Cook until clear. Once corn mixture is cooked, remove from oven, pour butter and sugar mixture over top and serve.
